item.title: Children throwing up the Sun (in this dialect)
item.summary: The Sun, a man from whose armpit brightness proceeded, lived formerly on earth; but only gave light for a space around his house. Some children belonging to the First Bushmen (who preceded the Flat Bushmen in their country) were therefore sent to throw up the sleeping Sun into the sky; since then, he shines all over the earth...Besides these [two complete versions], we have the beginning of a version in the dialect of Stuurmanâ€™s Fontein, the Karreebergen (B XXIV. 2262 and 2263). [Not translated]
item.comments: 1) This story is found in Book XXIV
item.author: Blaitje Snell
Daoud Moos

keyword.subkw: a story in Kareebergen Stuurmansfontein dialect
